job.title: Software Engineer
job.description: Job SummaryRandstad is seeking a Software Engineer with experience in Aerospace or the Automotive industry to support the Embedded development of a state-of-the-art alternative fuel Aircraft Propulsion System. You will work with a diverse international team and head up the design and development of the Control Systems. Your work will truly revolutionize air transportation across North America and Europe.location: Everett, Washingtonjob type: Permanentsalary: $135,000 - 145,000 per yearwork hours: 8am to 4pmeducation: BachelorsResponsibilities Select appropriate HW/SW platforms and architectures to achieve real-time data acquisition and control of complex systems including Propulsion system, power management, and safety featuresDevelop embedded code to perform system telemetry and control for these complex systems in real-time (< microseconds)Develop assorted software for a variety of subsystem test standsDevelop database and post processing software to support system troubleshooting, development and analysisBe able and willing to build or adapt new software development environments as needed.Create graphical user interfaces for real time system telemetry and control panelsMaintain high quality documentation of code base and architecturesHelp build our software engineering team as we growRequirements Demonstrated self-starter / learning related to software and firmwareExperience with relevant computer programming languages such as C/C++, PythonHands-on experience coding and testing prototype systemsAbility to plan projects and be accountable for deliverables & schedulesProficiency in DO178C or ISO 26262 and applicable standard for Software Life CycleProficiency in multi-application, multi-layer design , verification and implementationExperience in Software in the loop and Hardware in the loopEmphasis on real time high bandwidth control system theory, design, and implementationSerial digital communication knowledge (UART, I2C, CAN, SPI)Hands on experience with measurement and test equipment (oscilloscopes, DAQ's, etc)Circuit design and PCB layout for mixed power/signal applicationsApplication/GUI programmingExperience with version control systemsAltium experienceQualifications Experience level: ExperiencedMinimum 5 years of experienceEducation: Bachelors (required)SkillsEmbedded Software Full LifecycleEqual Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.
